column1: comments
The reduction in CSR threshold from 500 crore to 250 crore net worth is excellent and will bring more companies under CSR obligations.
I have serious concerns about the reduction in CSR threshold. This will burden smaller companies unnecessarily.
The amendment to section 135 regarding CSR requirements needs more clarity on implementation timeline.
This is a positive step towards expanding corporate social responsibility in India.
The penalties mentioned in section 447 are too harsh and will discourage business growth.
Good initiative on CSR, but the implementation mechanism needs better explanation.
The proposed changes to director disqualification in section 164 will create unnecessary bureaucratic burden.
I support the amendment to section 197 increasing managerial remuneration limit from 11% to 15%.
The language used in section 4 regarding company names is too technical for common understanding.
This legislation will help improve corporate governance standards significantly.
The implementation timeline for section 185 loan restrictions is unrealistic and needs extension.
I appreciate the government's efforts to modernize company regulations, but execution needs improvement.
The draft contains several ambiguities in section 399 regarding minority shareholder rights.
This amendment to section 135 will streamline CSR compliance and make it easier for companies.
I am concerned about the lack of provisions for small companies in the proposed legislation.
The digital signature requirements in section 2 need better infrastructure support.
This is a much-needed reform that will bring Indian company law in line with international standards.
The penalty structure in section 447 is disproportionate and may lead to closure of many companies.
I welcome the initiative to reduce CSR threshold as it will increase corporate responsibility.
The draft legislation should include more provisions for stakeholder consultation during implementation.
The proposed changes to section 197 are comprehensive but need better communication strategy.
I support the intent of section 164 amendments but have reservations about practical implementation.
This amendment will create a level playing field for all companies regardless of their size.
The compliance requirements in section 185 are too complex and may require additional training.
I believe this legislation will significantly improve the ease of doing business in India.
The draft needs more clarity on transitional provisions for existing companies.
This is a progressive step that will modernize our corporate regulatory framework effectively.
I have concerns about the enforcement mechanisms proposed in section 447.
The amendment addresses key issues but needs refinement in certain technical aspects.
I fully endorse this proposal as it will enhance transparency and accountability in corporate governance.
